subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Monday, 23 April, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Ferguson unconcerned by injuries
Sir Alex Ferguson is not worried by Man Utd's lengthy injury list ahead of the Champions League tie against AC Milan.



 
Hargreaves hails striker Berbatov
Owen Hargreaves tells BBC Sport Spurs striker Dimitar Berbatov deserves his place in the team of the year.



 
Ferguson sure referee was correct
Sir Alex Ferguson says the referee was right not to award a penalty against Man Utd on Saturday.








GOLF




Muirfield seniors bow for Faldo
Nick Faldo will return to the scene of his 1987 and 1992 Open wins for his Seniors Tour debut in July.



 
Jacquelin ranking boosted by win
Frenchman Raphael Jacquelin rises 43 places to 61st in the world rankings issued after his Asian Open victory.



 
Watney secures maiden PGA victory
American Nick Watney wins his maiden PGA Tour title at the New Orleans Classic.








MOTORSPORT




Turkey to keep F1 race until 2021
Formula One supremo Bernie Ecclestone guarantees the future of the Turkish Grand Prix for at least the next 15 years.



 
Schoolboy makes F3 racing history
A Sussex schoolboy makes his motor racing debut and becomes the youngest driver in Formula Three history.



 
Victorious Stoner overhauls Rossi
Casey Stoner wins the Turkish MotoGP to claim the overall world championship lead from Valentino Rossi.








FORMULA ONE




Turkey to keep F1 race until 2021
Formula One supremo Bernie Ecclestone guarantees the future of the Turkish Grand Prix for at least the next 15 years.



 
BMW may offer Heidfeld new deal
Nick Heidfeld's impressive start to the season could go a long way to landing a new deal with BMW Sauber.



 
Schumacher vows to answer critics
Ralf Schumacher aims to turn around his season when his Toyota car is "competitive again"








ATHLETICS




Yamauchi voices Osaka heat fears
Mara Yamauchi warns conditions in Osaka at the World Athletics Championships will be even tougher than during the London Marathon.



 
Runner dies after London Marathon
A 22-year-old runner who was taken ill after completing the London Marathon dies in hospital.



 
Lel wins London Marathon thriller
Martin Lel out-sprints his rivals to win the London Marathon for the second time.








CYCLING




Tour will snub dope-probe riders
Tour de France chief Christian Prudhomme says riders implicated in the Spanish doping scandal will not be welcome at this year's race.



 
Landis lines up return to racing
Floyd Landis will ride in events in the US this summer despite the ongoing doping inquiry into his 2006 Tour de France win.



 
Cavendish claims Belgian success
British cyclist Mark Cavendish held off a world-class field to win the Scheldeprijs Vlaanderen in Belgium.








FUN AND GAMES




Comment: Spot of bother for Jose
Robbo on Mourinho's claims of referees favouring Man Utd



 
Monday's gossip column
The Queen supports Arsenal, plus other rumours



 
Holloway column
Gary's fiery and he says 'You what?' The bloke says '£500,000 for a midget?'
